item.title: Sort Array By Parity
item.description: Problem Statement Given an array A of non-negative integers, return an array consisting of all the even elements of A, followed by all the odd elements of A. You may return any answer array that satisfies this condition. Questions to ask Is the input array mutable or read only? Can i have negative numbers in my input array? Solution There are two solutions for this problem with time complexity O(n) with just one pass in the array.

item.title: Squares of a Sorted Array
item.description: Problem Statement Given an array of integers A sorted in non-decreasing order, return an array of the squares of each number, also in sorted non-decreasing order. Questions to ask Can i have negative numbers in my input array? Is the input array mutable or read only? Solution The naive solution is to traverse the array calculating the square of each value and adding the result in a array to return.

item.title: Edit Distance
item.description: Problem Statement Given two words word1 and word2, find the minimum number of operations required to convert word1 to word2. You have the following 3 operations permitted on a word: Insert a character Delete a character Replace a character Solution If word1 = “horse” and word2 = “ros”, how can we solve the problem? In a first look the problem seens much more complex than it is.

item.title: Add Two Numbers
item.description: Problem Statement You are given two non-empty linked lists representing two non-negative integers. item.title: Two Sum
item.description: Problem Statement Given an array of integers, return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to a specific target. You may assume that each input would have exactly one solution, and you may not use the same element twice. Questions to ask Is the input array already sorted? Is the input array mutable or read only? Solution There are three main approaches to solve this problem: Naive, Time Optimized,Memory Optimized.
